title: Bluradio
text:
Blu Radio is a <a href="radio%20station">radio station</a> in <a href="Bogot%C3%A1">Bogotá</a>, <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>, owned by <a href="Caracol%20TV">Caracol TV</a>.
In July 2012, Caracol TV leased HJMD (the frequency of <a href="Melod%C3%ADa%20FM%20Est%C3%A9reo">Melodía FM Estéreo</a>, an easy listening station) from <a href="Cadena%20Melod%C3%ADa">Cadena Melodía</a>, in order to create a news radio station. Test broadcasts started soon after, with a <a href="soft%20AC">soft AC</a> format and simulcasting "<a href="Noticias%20Caracol">Noticias Caracol</a>".
Blu Radio started definitive broadcasts 6 September 2012. The news director is "Noticias Caracol" presenter Juan Roberto Vargas, and the morning news programme is presented by <a href="N%C3%A9stor%20Morales">Néstor Morales</a>, former <a href="Caracol%20Radio">Caracol Radio</a> personality.
Since late 2016, Blu Radio Bogotá broadcasts at 89.9 MHz after <a href="Caracol%20TV">Caracol TV</a> purchased Radial Bogotá, the owner of <a href="HJCK">HJCK</a>, a classical music and cultural radio station whose frequency were leased by <a href="Caracol%20Radio">Caracol Radio</a> in 2005. HJMD 96.9 MHz switched to a popular music format (rancheras, tex-mex, etc.) called <a href="La%20Kalle%20%28Colombia%29">La Kalle</a>.
Its main competitors are <a href="W%20Radio%20%28Colombia%29">W Radio</a>, <a href="La%20FM">La FM</a>, Caracol Radio, and <a href="RCN%20Radio">RCN Radio</a>.
Programming.
Blu Radio's schedule is similar to other FM talk stations in Bogotá, mainly W Radio and Caracol Radio: on weekdays, a news/debate morning show, a local programme on midday, variety and sports (mainly <a href="Association%20football">football</a>) on the afternoons, and a simulcast of "Noticias Caracol" and a programme devoted to technology and internet on the evenings. Weekends include a morning show, sports programming (again, mainly football), and music.
Affiliates.
Blu Radio's owners intend to build a national radio network, whose flagship will be Bogotá's HJCK.
